eprint.title: A depth-16 circuit for the AES S-box
eprint.abstract:
New techniques for reducing the depth of circuits for cryptographic applications are described and applied to the AES S-box. These techniques also keep the number of gates quite small. The result, when applied to the AES S-box, is a circuit with depth 16 and only 128 gates. For the inverse, it is also depth 16 and has only 127 gates.
There is a shared middle part, common to both the S-box and its inverse, consisting of 63 gates.
eprint.publication_info: Published elsewhere. Unknown where it was published
